ScriptConditionTemplate.HelpText: This will return true if the unit is dead or does not exist. It will also return true if the unit doesn�t currently exist but did in the past.

ScriptConditionTemplate.UIName: Object Type/Attacked, Destroyed, or Exists/Named object is dying. (Cinematic)
ScriptConditionTemplate.HelpText: Returns true if the unit is currently dead, if the unit doesn�t exist will return false. It will also return false if the unit used to exist but doesn�t any longer.

UIString.value: has been killed, but is still on screen.

ScriptConditionTemplate.UIName: Object Type/Attacked, Destroyed, or Exists/Named object is finished dying. (Cinematic)
ScriptConditionTemplate.HelpText: This will return true if the unit no longer exists but did in the past. If the unit currently exists it will return false.

UIString.value: has been killed, and is finished dying.

ScriptConditionTemplate.UIName: Object Type/Attacked, Destroyed, or Exists/Named object exists and is alive.
ScriptConditionTemplate.HelpText: This checks to see if the object exists on the level, and is not effectively dead. This means it will fire if the unit is around and not dead, a unit in its slow death will cause this to return false.
